sen.e: Originally, Gozu Tenno (gośīrşa) is an Indian deity and the guardian deity of Gion-shoja (the Jetavana monastery).

sen.e: According to extant "Bingonokuni Fudoki" included in "Shaku Nihongi, Course of Japanese History", he was a prince of Buto Tenjin, his name was Gozu Tenno, he married with a daughter of Shakara Ryuo, one of Hachidai Ryuo, Eight Dragon, and he had eight princes.

sen.j: 日本では、猛威ある御霊的神格を持っていることからスサノオと習合し、京都祇園の八坂神社に祀られ除疫神として尊崇された。
sen.e: In Japan, he amalgamated with Susanoo as he was a deity of ferocious nature and was enshrined at Yasaka-jinja Shrine in Gion, Kyoto and was worshiped as Joeki-shin.

sen.e: The faith for Gozu Tenno and Susanoo, which is the syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism, is called Gion veneration and it had spread nationwide by the Medieval Period.
